bibl.title: The Provenance of the Greek-Coptic Glossary to Hosea and Amos.
bibl.note: Takes a closer look at the land register on the front side of P. Lond. Inv. EA 10825 verso (= van Haelst 286; LDAB 3141). Prosopographical links with other documents suggest that the land register probably relates to the Oxyrhynchite nome, which is consistent with the Mesokemic dialect of the Coptic part of the glossary.
bibl.seg: Amin Benaissa, The Provenance of the Greek-Coptic Glossary to Hosea and Amos.

Takes a closer look at the land register on the front side of P. Lond. Inv. EA 10825 verso (= van Haelst 286; LDAB 3141). Prosopographical links with other documents suggest that the land register probably relates to the Oxyrhynchite nome, which is consistent with the Mesokemic dialect of the Coptic part of the glossary.
